TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DatatypeFactory extends Java.Lang.Object

remarks.para: Factory that creates new javax.xml.datatypeObjects that map XML to/from Java Objects.
is used to create a new DatatypeFactory. The following implementation resolution mechanisms are used in the following order:

item.term: If the system property specified by , "javax.xml.datatype.DatatypeFactory", exists, a class with the name of the property's value is instantiated. Any Exception thrown during the instantiation process is wrapped as a .

If the file ${JAVA_HOME}/lib/jaxp.properties exists, it is loaded in a Object. The PropertiesObject is then queried for the property as documented in the prior step and processed as documented in the prior step.
The services resolution mechanism is used, e.g. META-INF/services/java.xml.datatype.DatatypeFactory. Any Exception thrown during the instantiation process is wrapped as a .
The final mechanism is to attempt to instantiate the Class specified by , "javax.xml.datatype.DatatypeFactoryImpl". Any Exception thrown during the instantiation process is wrapped as a .

remarks.para: Note that you must supply your own implementation (such as Xerces); Android does not ship with a default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Javax.Xml.Datatype.Duration NewDuration (long durationInMilliSeconds);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Javax.Xml.Datatype.Duration NewDuration(int64 durationInMilliSeconds) cil managed

format.blockquote: duration represents a duration of time. The value space of duration is a six-dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second components defined in Section 5.5.3.2 of [ISO 8601], respectively. These components are ordered in their significance by their order of appearance i.e. as year, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

item.term: Date/Time Datatype Field Mapping Between XML Schema 1.0 and Java Representation

format.blockquote: duration represents a duration of time. The value space of duration is a six-dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second components defined in Section 5.5.3.2 of [ISO 8601], respectively. These components are ordered in their significance by their order of appearance i.e. as year, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

item.term: Date/Time Datatype Field Mapping Between XML Schema 1.0 and Java Representation

remarks.para: Obtain a new instance of a Duration specifying the Duration as milliseconds.
XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes, 3.2.6 duration, defines duration as:
All six values are set by computing their values from the specified milliseconds and are available using the get methods of the created . The values conform to and are defined by:

The default start instance is defined by 's use of the start of the epoch: i.e., = 1970, = , = 1, etc. This is important as there are variations in the Gregorian Calendar, e.g. leap years have different days in the month = so the result of and can be influenced.

format.blockquote: duration represents a duration of time. duration represents a duration of time. The value space of duration is a six-dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second components defined in Section 5.5.3.2 of [ISO 8601], respectively. These components are ordered in their significance by their order of appearance i.e. as year, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

remarks.para: Obtain a new instance of a Duration specifying the Duration as its string representation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", as defined in XML Schema 1.0 section 3.2.6.1.
XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes, 3.2.6 duration, defines duration as:
All six values are set and available from the created

The XML Schema specification states that values can be of an arbitrary size. Implementations may chose not to or be incapable of supporting arbitrarily large and/or small values. An will be thrown with a message indicating implementation limits if implementation capacities are exceeded.

Docs.exception: If lexicalRepresentation is not a valid representation of a Duration.
If implementation cannot support requested values.
if lexicalRepresentation is null.

item.term: Date/Time Datatype Field Mapping Between XML Schema 1.0 and Java Representation
Date/Time Datatype Field Mapping Between XML Schema 1.0 and Java Representation

remarks.para: Create a Duration of type xdt:dayTimeDuration using the specified milliseconds as defined in .

The datatype xdt:dayTimeDuration is a subtype of xs:duration whose lexical representation contains only day, hour, minute, and second components. This datatype resides in the namespace http://www.w3.org/2003/11/xpath-datatypes.
All four values are set by computing their values from the specified milliseconds and are available using the get methods of the created . The values conform to and are defined by:

The default start instance is defined by 's use of the start of the epoch: i.e., = 1970, = , = 1, etc. This is important as there are variations in the Gregorian Calendar, e.g. leap years have different days in the month = so the result of can be influenced.
Any remaining milliseconds after determining the day, hour, minute and second are discarded.

remarks.para: Create a Duration of type xdt:dayTimeDuration by parsing its String representation, "PnDTnHnMnS", .

The datatype xdt:dayTimeDuration is a subtype of xs:duration whose lexical representation contains only day, hour, minute, and second components. This datatype resides in the namespace http://www.w3.org/2003/11/xpath-datatypes.
All four values are set and available from the created

The XML Schema specification states that values can be of an arbitrary size. Implementations may chose not to or be incapable of supporting arbitrarily large and/or small values. An will be thrown with a message indicating implementation limits if implementation capacities are exceeded.

Docs.exception: If the given string does not conform to the aforementioned specification.
If implementation cannot support requested values.
If lexicalRepresentation is null.

remarks.para: Create a Duration of type xdt:yearMonthDuration using the specified milliseconds as defined in .
The datatype xdt:yearMonthDuration is a subtype of xs:duration whose lexical representation contains only year and month components. This datatype resides in the namespace .
Both values are set by computing their values from the specified milliseconds and are available using the get methods of the created . The values conform to and are defined by:

The default start instance is defined by 's use of the start of the epoch: i.e., = 1970, = , = 1, etc. This is important as there are variations in the Gregorian Calendar, e.g. leap years have different days in the month = so the result of can be influenced.
Any remaining milliseconds after determining the year and month are discarded.

remarks.para: Create a new instance of an XMLGregorianCalendar.
All date/time datatype fields set to or null.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Javax.Xml.Datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar NewXMLGregorianCalendar (Java.Util.GregorianCalendar cal);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Javax.Xml.Datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar NewXMLGregorianCalendar(class Java.Util.GregorianCalendar cal) cil managed

remarks.para: Create an XMLGregorianCalendar from a .

tr.th: Field by Field Conversion from to an

remarks.para: *conversion loss of information. It is not possible to represent a java.util.GregorianCalendar daylight savings timezone id in the XML Schema 1.0 date/time datatype representation.

To compute the return value's TimeZone field,
when this.getTimezone() != FIELD_UNDEFINED, create a java.util.TimeZone with a custom timezone id using the this.getTimezone().
else use the GregorianCalendar default timezone value for the host is defined as specified by java.util.TimeZone.getDefault().

Docs.exception: If cal is null.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Javax.Xml.Datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar NewXMLGregorianCalendar (string lexicalRepresentation);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Javax.Xml.Datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar NewXMLGregorianCalendar(string lexicalRepresentation) cil managed

Docs.param: Lexical representation of one the eight XML Schema date/time datatypes.

remarks.para: Create a new XMLGregorianCalendar by parsing the String as a lexical representation.
Parsing the lexical string representation is defined in
The string representation may not have any leading and trailing whitespaces.
The parsing is done field by field so that the following holds for any lexically correct String x:
Except for the noted lexical/canonical representation mismatches listed in .

Docs.exception: If the lexicalRepresentation is not a valid XMLGregorianCalendar.
If lexicalRepresentation is null.

remarks.para: Constructor allowing for complete value spaces allowed by W3C XML Schema 1.0 recommendation for xsd:dateTime and related builtin datatypes. Note that year parameter supports arbitrarily large numbers and fractionalSecond has infinite precision.
A null value indicates that field is not set.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
